headline.main: URGES EXTENSION OF SHOOTING ORDER; Andrews, at Navy Day Dinner, Asks Nation to Broaden Power of President

lead_paragraph: The time for action Has come, Rear Admiral Adolphus Andrews, commandant of the Third Naval District, declared last nigght in a Navy and Total Defense Day address, in which he called upon the nation to give President Roosevelt power to extend to all waters his "shoot on sight" order to our Navy.
abstract: Urges extension of Roosevelt shoot on sight order, s to Mil Order of the World War

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY, AMER (N Y C)
